skill.name: generate-output
skill.description: Create the deliverable (code, documentation, tests, content) following the user's standards and best practices. Use after validation passes to actually build the work product.
skill.summary: Create the deliverable (code, documentation, tests, content) following the user's standards and best...
skill.author: AbeJitsu

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no code execution capabilities. Contains only documentation describing a workflow for generating deliverables. No filesystem access, network calls, environment variables, or external commands.

content.value_statement: Transform validated requirements into ready-to-use code, documentation, and tests. This skill follows your project standards and patterns to ensure consistency and quality across all deliverables.
actual_capabilities: Create production-ready code following user-defined patterns
Generate documentation with structure, examples, and troubleshooting
Write comprehensive test suites with edge case coverage
Produce content with clear introduction, sections, and takeaways
Apply refactoring with before/after comparisons and explanations
Follow project-specific standards and principles from standards.json
limitations: Requires validated requirements from a previous step
Relies on standards.json for project-specific patterns
Does not execute or validate the generated code itself

use_cases.title: Generate Code Features
use_cases.description: Create production-ready code with proper types, error handling, and documentation from validated requirements.

use_cases.title: Create Documentation
use_cases.description: Generate clear, structured documentation with examples, troubleshooting, and proper formatting.

use_cases.title: Write Test Suites
use_cases.description: Create comprehensive test coverage including happy paths, edge cases, and setup/teardown logic.

prompt_templates.title: Generate Component
prompt_templates.prompt: Use generate-output skill. Project type: React Component. Requirements: [describe component]. Standards: load from standards.json.

prompt_templates.title: Write API Docs
prompt_templates.prompt: Use generate-output skill. Project type: Documentation. Requirements: Document /users endpoint. Include examples, params, responses.

prompt_templates.title: Create Test Suite
prompt_templates.prompt: Use generate-output skill. Project type: Test Suite. Requirements: Test UserService. Include happy path and edge cases.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor Module
prompt_templates.prompt: Use generate-output skill. Project type: Refactoring. Before code: [paste code]. Apply patterns from standards.json. Explain improvements.

output_examples.input: Generate a React search component with keyboard navigation following my TypeScript standards.
output: Summary: A complete, accessible search component with keyboard support
Common Patterns Included: TypeScript types, PropTypes validation, Storybook story
Deliverable: Full component code with comments, keyboard handlers, and usage example

best_practices: Load project standards before generating to ensure consistency with existing codebase
Include all supporting elements: types, comments, examples, and error handling
Apply user-defined patterns and anti-patterns guidance throughout the deliverable
anti_patterns: Generating code without checking project-specific patterns and conventions
Skipping error handling or validation for complex logic sections
Creating incomplete deliverables that require additional work before use

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Install via the skills manager in your AI tool.

faq.question: What types of deliverables can this skill create?
faq.answer: Code features, documentation, test suites, refactored code, and content. Each has specific guidance in the skill.

faq.question: How does it know my project standards?
faq.answer: The skill reads your standards.json file via StandardsRepository to load principles and common patterns for your project type.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill that only processes requirements locally. No data is sent to external services.

faq.question: What if I have no standards file?
faq.answer: The skill generates output following general best practices for the project type. Create a standards.json file for custom patterns.

faq.question: How does this differ from a code generation prompt?
faq.answer: This skill specifically applies your project's patterns, principles, and anti-patterns. It ensures consistency with your existing codebase.
